reviews.review_msg: this was terrible. pretends like she cares about people with CAL accommodations but does not. expects you to read a whole book in a week as if you have nothing else going on in your life. assignments weren't that hard if you could read stuff like Anne frank's diary, Molly painter-downes, Mary lamb bobak, etc. entries all in time for class.

Michelle is an amazing professor. Everything was laid out in rubrics on how you were graded. We had two field trips during the course, which were great experiences. We also had one bonus assignment, where she would drop your lowest grade. Participation was based on whether you showed up to the in-class portion of the hybrid class. Would take again!

Lectures felt somewhat unnecessary because too much time was spent trying to engage with the large class of 250+ people and you did not need all the presented information to do well on the assignments (just do the readings and come to tutorial with some of your own analysis). I did like Professor Levy's unique assignments though!!

Her grading criteria is non existent. Her expectations about what is needed seem to be completely arbitrary. When you ask for clarification it is not given and anything she does say is passive aggressive. Her lectures add absolutely nothing to the text. The course would be the same if it had no prof.

She is so nice and gives great feedback. Her lectures are structured and she has great questions to discuss about the texts you read, which themselves are interesting. She does a good job in engaging everyone and honestly even if you didn't read the text, just show up to class and you'll still get the marks.
Prof is incredibly rude and impatient! WILL impact your mental health with her belittling attitude while you are just trying to reach out for help!

I had Dr. Levy for ENGL 320, and she was the most understanding professor I've ever had. She really cares about her students and wants them all to succeed. Sometimes the course material can get a bit boring, but Dr. Levy is extremely passionate and will make it interesting!

Took this class in 2020. She would only do lectures with the students every 3 weeks, which was unfortunate since our books would be done by then. There were 4 books, 3 of them were interesting one was so complex boring. I got away with only reading 2/4 books and getting a good grade, that's English for you lol. TAs were the highlight of the class!

Amazing. Had her for the first full online term and she was very considerate and easy to talk to. She gives amazing feedback and wants to see her students improve. She definitely made this online transition easier. 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Levy is amazing! If you're passionate about literature, take her class. She's really good with online learning and she keeps her students engaged. She makes her students read and work a lot, but I felt that I had improved a lot as an English student throughout her course. Her deadlines were very reasonable. She's passionate about education!
Michelle is awesome. She keeps the class engaged and always wants to help. One of the best courses and professors I have had.

Levy is a fantastic lecturer and presents the material in an exciting, refreshing way! She is extremely intelligent, helpful, passionate and keeps her discussions interesting! Marking scale is fair and she is always available to help. One of the best english prof's i've had so far! TA's were awesome - I would absolutely recommend Levy as a prof!!!

Levy is a fantastic lecturer and is excellent at allowing students to think differently about the material! Extremely fair marker, so helpful, extremely nice and very intelligent. Presentations were lovely and class discussions very interesting! TA's were excellent, it was one of my favourite courses so far. I would absolutely recommend Dr. Levy!!
This course wasn't easy. The texts can be complicated. However if you go to your TA they can be very helpful!
Her lectures are not helpful at all, she goes over the plot at the lectures and general ideas which is already obvious. will never take her class again. :(

Unprofessional, never on time. Classes were ENTIRELY student led (all discussions).  Michelle rarely lectured and even if she did, her comments were empty and vague. Absolutely ruined Jane Austen for me.  Worst English prof I've ever had.
She's nice, but her slides are cluttered and hard to read, and the questions she asks are obvious.

The first thing this professor said on day one was, "I'm not here to entertain you." She definitely lives up to that. Lectures are not only extremely uninteresting but her comments and interpretation of the texts are quite obvious. It's not surprising nobody will engage her trivial questions. She is very frustrating.

Decent enough - not amazing, but I'd probably take another class with her. Could be pretty boring in her lectures and definitely treated the class like we were 6 year olds who had never taken an English class before. Yes I know who Jane Austen is, yes I know what a metaphor is... Lovely lady just a bit of a pain as a professor. Easy class though.

A great teacher. She always has different class exercises that get to the heart of the material. She is engaging and intelligent. Discussions are always involved and interesting. She encourages conversation but (helpfully, and politely) tells you when you're just plain wrong. very personable. i learned a lot.

I had Michelle for ENGL 206 two years ago. She was a bit boring and I did not like the stuffed overhead slides..I was paying more attention to writing them down instead of her speaking. She also seems a little proud, which affects the way she imposes her interpretations. She is my prof for ENGL 322 in Spring 2010. Let's hope something changes.

The 2nd time I've had a class with Michelle--once again, an amazing class! Encourages group work and critical thinking; gives pointers on improvement; allowed revisions of our first essay for extra marks. Very organized, puts a lot of effort into teaching.  Appreciates thoughtful insights based on close readings. Highly recommend! Great prof :)

Levy seems to think she's teaching remedial English -- in a third-year class. She will ask incredibly insulting questions like: "Has anyone heard of the French Revolution?", allows for no moments of intelligence or spontaneity from discussions, and her own insights are vapid and obvious. Don't take -- possibly the worst Prof in the English Dept.

Didn't get anything out of lecture but her ruining the ending before it was due to be read.  I got more out of the TA than I did out of her and thought he should have taught the class.  (Attendance would have been better)

I rarely attended lecture and was still able to pull a good grade just by reading the novels and writing the papers. Easy course, great novel selections, but fell asleep in lecture when I did attend. Did not touch upon anything not covered excessively in high school. Her views on the novels were not open to discussion.

easy papers, as she and the TAs are extremely helpful. michelle gives very detailed outlines on how to write the papers,and the TA's are very generous. the final exam was a breeze, she basically told us what was going to be on the exam, outlined the terms we needed to know and everything. great prof! definitely recommended.

Reading is very heavy for a first year eng class. But assignments and such are straight forward. If you don't understand what she wants seriously go ask her or your TA otherwise the marks for your papers will tell. Easy final.

Really enjoyed this course, not too difficult at all, just keep up with the readings and study the notes for the final exam.  Very helpful w/ improving essays, doing close reading, etc.  Very nice, definitely will be taking another course with her...
Really nice prof. Go to her office hours, this will bring your mark up. Readings very heavy, but it's upper level english after all
Michelle Levy didn't touch upon anything we didn't learn in English 12. She was too set in her opinion and didn't take into consideration other students' opinions.

Michelle is a high quality prof. She is helpful, engaging, and very sweet. Yes, her readings are heavy, but this is university english, not Lit12. And to the person who slagged her fashion sense: I think you need to straighten out your priorities, missy. ;-)

Michelle is sweet, in this course there was some reading that was definitely superfluous but overall I loved the selections. Her essay topics allow you to follow your own interests in the course while her lectures give a good general base of knowledge. I would recommend taking this class if you enjoy Romantic Poetry

Michelle Levy was very out of touch with the needs of university-level students. She very much complicated the uncomplicated and was disorganized and sloppy while demanding too much and providing too little. However, she at least is a surprisingly easy marker for all that she expects and patronizingly overcomplicates and overclarifies.

michelle is really nice but she will make you work hard for your grade.  she really encourages using her office hours for help with essays, so i recommend going to see her right before your paper is due.  she likes when students come to talk to her about assignments and is pretty helpful.

I really enjoyed her teaching; she is really knowledgeable and genuinely wants you to do well in her class. The amount of reading is not unreasonable and the assignment outlines are comprehensive and helpful. She is a really great prof, who really loves the material she teaches. If you can, take a class with her.

Michelle is a genuinely nice person yet her lectures lack any sort of fun and are very monotonous. She is very ambitious with her reading schedule, and expects her students to read a lot of information in a veyr short time period. She is very helpful when it comes to office hours and helping with your essays via email or personal visits.
No Comments

Easy class with lots of review. Kinda like redoing highschool english. Although those who said disagreeing with her bit you in the ass, I disagree. I blatantly disagreed with her reading of a poem on my first explication and got the exact mark I deserved for the quality of the writing in my essay.
do yourselves a favor, avoid her...

Levy is a great prof. To those who posted below-Welcome to University...maybe you should take more than one English class before you start slandering good profs. Lectures were fun and engaging. Assignments were clear and fairly marked. Michelle has a genuine interest in teaching and in her students.
She didn't really try to make lecture interesting.  Instead she used microscopic overhead notes.  I didn't think the class was difficult but definately not interesting.

To the person below me, who would consider Michelle engaging. I have a gpa over 4 (at least 1/2 a brain last time i checked) and found this class to be the biggest waste of time. I have to agree that the final was easy, but a prof should make it so students want to come to class...she did not.

Michelle is an excellent and capable teacher. Those who dislike her do not have the capacity to analyze or enjoy poetry. Through her I lectures I found her to be an interesting, cheerful and helpful person. For those with the interest and half a brain, she was engaging. A+! (Easy final, too:))
Boring class. Throws her interpretations of a poem at you and calls it final.

Boring class ever. I enjoyed English in high school too, but this just sucked. Stopped going to class about half-way in...just couldn't take it. Worst of all is that the other English classes aren't much better...good this it's not my major.

i totally agree with the comment below mine. she TOTALLY killed english for me...and i used to LOVE it in grade 12!!! finals are impossible...i barely finished in time and in the end i don't even know what i wrote about...my answers turned out to be just as disorganized as her class! she sucks!

She just about killed poetry for me. Did not seem too enthused with the subject, lecture was boring, no new material/ terminology unless you've missed English 8-12. Agree with all she says, it'll save you a bite in the behind when you get your essays back.

i had her for romantic lit, and she was all right.  i didn't have a direct problem with her, and i don't have any reason not to like her.  she is really helpful though, for papers.  take advantage of her office hours.

The most boring class ever. I agree with the comment before mine. she's soon 2 be busted by the fashion police. cuz what she wears is most definately illegal. if she gave an extra 20 mins 2 copy notes maybe i would get them all. plus u r too busy copying notes 2 pay attention to what she is saying.

if anyone had trouble grasping the meanings of the concepts she was teaching, they are sleeping through the lectures!Pretty dry, and her overheads are way too long and she doesn't put them up online, but she explains eveything well. Someone should notify "What Not To Wear" she needs some style help
I'm sure glad that I had some previous experience with poetry. Otherwise, I'd be sunk.
I really enjoy her lectures and her style, but that's because I put the time in to get acquainted with her style. She's got interesting methods, that's for sure.
don't get what she's talking about, and notes are super long and there's never enough time to get it all down. class lacks an aspect of humanity.

I had a really hard time with her style of teaching. She seemed rather cold to me when I asked her questions. After I asked for her help on my assignment and talked to her for a bit, she has been much better, If she knows you are trying, she will marker you easier it seems.

don't like her. i haven't had her mark anything yet, but she seems hard. she's tecnically challenged, yet insists on using projections and sound clips and stuff, so lots of time is wasted trying to set that up. her notes are on slides and she feels the need to cover tehm so thry're hard to copy. boo
so boring

Had her for Romantic Lit.  She's super nice and always availiable to help you.  Take her up on it-you'll see an improvement in your grade. Her teaching style is difficult and confusing.  Oftentimes I don't even think she knows what she's talking about!
the course is alright but don't expect your efforts to reflect in your grade.  she is so hard to please and critiques everything about your work.
